comment.author: 39340091@N05
comment._content:
My late grandfather Jack Wilson MM trained in Avros & Bristol Fighters, Crail, Scotland in 1918. Things rarely went smoothly:
Another morning we were sitting and having breakfast. This plane nose dived into the ground right outside the window, it was a Bristol Fighter. The plane I was being trained to fly. There were both killed outright. A Lieutenant Munday, the instructor and a Flight Sergeant. I’ve got a picture of that. They’re both buried in Crail Cemetery. There are a few of our lads there.
All of this & more in a 25,000 word verbatim memoir from interviews conducted with Jack Wilson MM in his 97th year.

comment.author: 12980721@N07
comment._content: Hi, I'm an admin for a group called Australian Flying Corps AFC, and we'd love to have this added to the group!
